TopicTitle: Little plane is shaking and breaking apart upon takeoff [solved]

Articles.Content:
I'm building my first little airplane since the KSP V1.1.2 update.
I'm using FAR like always. And it's analysis says, my plane is well-ish designed.
But when starting from the runway with or without SAS, it doesn't want to take off, even at 140 m/s.
And the plane begins to vibrate and shake left-to-right on its two rear landing gears at about above 70 m/s until it disassembles itself on the runway
before I have the chance to take off.
My plane is completely symmetrical and I even exchanged the wings from two aeroplane tail fins to delta wings, because I thought they may act weird if misused as main wings.
I increased the control surcfaces, added canards. But it still rips apart before lifting off the ground.
The front steering wheel is set to "no friction" like many players here recommend, to avoid skidding off the runway.
My TWR is 1.53.

Plane

Any Ideas what's going on here?
It feels really different from my expierience in KSP 1.0.5...

EDIT: I moved the rear landing gear forward, directly under the CoL now to have a better leverage when pitching up.
But it still wobbles like mad on those rear gears and explodes before liftoff.

EDIT: Solved.
I attached medium landing gears now. That did the trick.
I heard that landing gears are now a big factor. But having to use those heavy, large "medium landing gears" on such a small, light craft seems odd to me.

Edited May 26, 2016 by Cairol
